title: The Best Ways to Convert a PowerPoint to a JPEG

steps.title: Select the slide you want to save (if you want to save a specific slide).
steps.content: Select the slide you want to save (if you want to save a specific slide). It's a thumbnail on the left side of your screen. Use this method to save the entire presentation or individual slides as an image. If you don't see the slides on the left side of your window, go to View > Normal (it's in the "Presentation Views" grouping).

steps.title: Click File and click Save As.
steps.content: Click File and click Save As . This will allow you to save a single slide. On Mac, click File then Export . [1] X Research source Continue saving your file, like selecting where to save it to and the file name.

steps.title: Select JPEG File Interchange Format (*.jpg) from the file-type drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select JPEG File Interchange Format (*.jpg) from the file-type drop-down menu. The file format is .jpg, but it works just like a .jpeg. The two are interchangeable formats.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . A window will pop up.

steps.title: Select Just this one or All Sides.
steps.content: Select Just this one or All Sides . You can either save one slide as an image or everything. If you opted to select all files, each slide will be saved as a separate JPEG image. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Search online for a tool to use.
steps.content: Search online for a tool to use. Use this method if you do not have PowerPoint available or if your version of PowerPoint does not allow you to convert your presentation to JPEG images. Search for "convert ppt to jpg" in a search engine of your choice. There are dozens of web-based tools online that do not require a download. Try using an online web-based tool such as Zamzar or Convertio. Other tools may act slightly differently but will use a similar method of converting your presentation. Use your discretion when using links from untrustworthy sources, as other sites might perform malicious actions on your computer.

steps.title: Open your PowerPoint file.
steps.content: Open your PowerPoint file. Click "Choose Files" or "Browse Files". The wording may not be exactly the same, but it will allow you to use File Manager to choose the PPT to convert. This opens a file browser that requires a PowerPoint (*.ppt) file as a source. Double-click to select the file and close your file manager. If needed, select jpg/jpeg as the format you want to convert to.

steps.title: Click Convert File to JPG or Convert Now.
steps.content: Click Convert File to JPG or Convert Now . This text varies depending on your online tool, but it's similar. Click on the "Open" link that appears afterward to download the converted slides to your computer. This link will remain active for one hour.
